name: 陳雅玫
objective: This course intends to enhance students' reading and listening abilities by using English news reports selected from newspapers (e.g. New York Times and The Guardian), news magazines (e.g. Times and Newsweek) and online news websites (e.g. CNN Student News). It will help students enrich their vocabulary and acquire key English expressions and sentence patterns used in different realms like politics, arts, entertainment, science & technology, sports, business and health. Additionally, diverse forms of activities will be arranged to enable students to develop effective reading skills. This course is also designed to strengthen students' listening abilities through the use of video-audio materials from on-line news channels.
schedule:
Week 1  Introduction
Week 2  Characteristics of News English
Week 3  International and Political News (1)
Week 4  International and Political News (2)
Week 5  Arts and Entertainment News (1)
Week 6  Arts and Entertainment News (2)
Week 7  Science and Technology News (1)
Week 8  Science and Technology News (2); Mid-term Exam
Week 9  English Proficiency Test
Week 10  Sports News (1)
Week 11  Sports News (2) 
Week 12  Business and Finance News (1)
Week 13  Business and Finance News (2)
Week 14  Health and Environment News (1)
Week 15  Health and Environment News (2)
Week 16  Review; Oral Presentations (1)
Week 17  Oral Presentations (2); Final Exam
Week 18  English Proficiency Test
scorePolicy:
1. continuous assessment (attendance, participation, exercises and quizzes): 40%
2. one dubbing project (including the oral presentation): 10%
3. mid-term and final exams: 30% 
4. two proficiency tests: 30%
